snippet: A month into the school year, teachers in New York City’s public schools are pushing on despite missing important new materials that were ordered to match the tougher Common Core standards.
abstract: Teachers in New York City's public schools are still missing important new math and English materials that were ordered in spring to match tougher Common Core test standards taking root across country; shipping delay has forced them to improvise, using old textbooks and downloading material from Internet.
lead_paragraph: A month into the school year, teachers in New York City’s public schools are pushing on despite missing important new materials that were ordered to match the tougher Common Core standards.

headline.main: Tardy Deliveries Keep New Books Out of Teachers’ Hands
headline.print_headline: Tardy Deliveries Keep New Books Out of Teachers’ Hands
